pkgmetadata.longdescription: Network Representations of Attitudes // A tool for computing network representations of attitudes, extracted from tabular data such as sociological surveys. By treating a survey as a bipartite network, we measure the similarity between respondents and survey items to produce network edges. We do this in both a respondent network, as well as a survey item network. Used in combination with graph visualisation libraries, this techniques helps practitioners in the social sciences identify network structure that may be present within a survey at a glance.
